page.title: 09MEMORIES OF BLACKO RESIDENT
page.content: Mrs. Whitehead is 89 years old and has lived in Blacko all her life. As a little girl she wore 2 petticoats, a dress and an apron. She had to go to Chapel 4 times each Sunday. A typical {SUNDAY DINNER}would have been roast beef, potatoes, carrots followed by rice pudding. When she was at school the{HEADMASTER}was{MR.CLEGG.}The present school hall was divided into 3 by curtains. On leaving school she went to work in{BLACKO MILL.}Fire emergencies were dealt with using water from a stream behind the{CHAPEL. {SHOPS}included{POST OFFICE, GROCERS and a{GREENGROCERS.}The{ROAD}was limestone and had no pavements.{PUBLIC {TRANSPORT}was by{WAGONETTE}on Saturday otherwise you had to walk to{NELSON}to catch the tram to{BURNLEY.}A tape recording of Mrs. Whitehead's memories is buried in{DOMESDAY BOX}near{SCHOOL.
